basics.name: Sebastian Messier
basics.label: Founder, Software Architect
basics.summary: Engineer with broad practical knowledge of software, testing, analytics, performance, and agile development. I care deeply about the end user, collaborating effectively with others, and most importantly, building things people need.

work.name: AirMed
work.summary: I realized the CPAP purchasing experience was a nightmare. I performed customer interviews to verify the problem was real and built the technology to streamline the CPAP purchase experience. Brought on an amazing CEO and raised 1M in seed funding.
highlights: Maintained relationships with physicians, vendors, and customers.
Mocked up, scoped, architected, and shipped our products from scratch.
Brought company from 0 to 18k MRR over the course of a year.

work.name: AirMed
work.summary: Transitioned from CTO to advisor role. As a board member I assist the company on technical hiring, and R&D.

work.name: Capital One
work.summary: Delivered features and enhancements on customer facing iPad app used in branches. Grew our knowledge of best practices, and established quality standards through out our code base.
highlights: Worked on enhancements and features for in-branch iPad app in Swift.
Brought customer-centric startup mentality and established high software standards within team.
Built customer queue API with Typescript, AWS Lambdas, and AWS DynamoDB.
Lead regular meetings to address and triage issues related to tech debt.

work.name: flexEngage
work.summary: A YC backed digital receipts startup. JMy first taste of the startup experience.
highlights: Joined during period of hyper-growth. On boarded Under Armour, Michael Kors, and Grupo Exito (Amazon of South America)
Design, implement, test, and shipped micro-services written in Java/Spring, Docker, and deployed on AWS.
QA duties included running tests and establishing ownership of test suites.
Lead regular meetings to address and triage issues faced by other teams.

work.name: Apple
work.summary: Interned at Apple, Inc. Worked within the hardware diagnostics department. Goal was to curb return fraud by distinguishing genuine/fabricated hardware failures.
highlights: Wrote diagnostics suites for iPhone hardware in Matlab, Lua, and Objective-C.
Built diagnostics data collection tool to gather and organize test results at scale.
Presented optical image stabilization diagnostic proof of concept to executives.
